Key Match Events: Klay Thompson started the game with an impressive 8 points, 3 rebounds, and 1 assist in the first quarter.
Thompson made back-to-back 3-pointers to give the Mavericks a little life in the fourth quarter.
The Houston Rockets held Kyrie Irving to 16 points, one of the lowest totals for Irving since Luka Doncic went out.
Pre-Game Insights: Klay Thompson returned to play for the Dallas Mavericks after missing one game due to an illness.
The Dallas Mavericks have struggled since Luka Doncic strained his left calf against the Minnesota Timberwolves on Christmas.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dallas Mavericks lost their third straight game and fourth in their last five games.
Klay Thompson has been inefficient since Luka Doncic went out, shooting 4-for-8 against the Rockets and 7-for-24 from deep in his last three games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dallas Mavericks trailed 61-52 at halftime.
Klay Thompson struggled defensively in the third quarter, forcing Jason Kidd to go to Quentin Grimes and Jaden Hardy.
Others: The Houston Rockets, ranked second in defensive rating, held Kyrie Irving to 16 points.
Luka Doncic will be re-evaluated after one month.
